{"step_by_step_thinking": "The Weber-Fechner law is a principle in the field of psychophysics, which is a branch of psychology. This law states that the change in a stimulus that will be just noticeable is a constant ratio of the original stimulus. It's all about the relationship between the intensity of the stimulus and the perception of the stimulus. It doesn't relate to the number of nerve fibers or muscle fibers.", "answer_choice": "D. Intensity of stimulus"}
